005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.constraint;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.markup.MarkupMultiline;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.DynamicContext;
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.ISequence;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.node.IDefinitionNodeItem;
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.IAttributable;
013import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.IDescribable;
014
015import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
016import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.Nullable;
017
018/**
019 * Represents a rule constraining the model of a Metaschema assembly, field or
020 * flag. Provides a common interface for all constraint definitions.
021 */
022public interface IConstraint extends IAttributable, IDescribable {
023  enum Kind {
024    NOT_APPLICABLE,
025    PASS,
026    FAIL,
027    INFORMATIONAL;
028  }
029
030  /**
031   * The degree to which a constraint violation is significant.
032   * <p>
033   * These values are ordered from least significant to most significant.
034   */
035  enum Level {
036    /**
037     * No violation.
038     */
039    NONE,
040    /**
041     * A violation of the constraint represents a point of interest.
042     */
043    INFORMATIONAL,
044    /**
045     * A violation of the constraint represents a fault in the content that may
046     * warrant review by a developer when performing model or tool development.
047     */
048    DEBUG,
049    /**
050     * A violation of the constraint represents a potential issue with the content.
051     */
052    WARNING,
053    /**
054     * A violation of the constraint represents a fault in the content. This may
055     * include issues around compatibility, integrity, consistency, etc.
056     */
057    ERROR,
058    /**
059     * A violation of the constraint represents a serious fault in the content that
060     * will prevent typical use of the content.
061     */
062    CRITICAL;
063  }
064
065  /**
066   * The default level to use if no level is provided.
067   */
068  @NonNull
069  Level DEFAULT_LEVEL = Level.ERROR;
070
071  /**
072   * The default target Metapath expression to use if no target is provided.
073   */
074  @NonNull
075  String DEFAULT_TARGET_METAPATH = ".";
076
077  /**
078   * Retrieve the unique identifier for the constraint.
079   *
080   * @return the identifier or {@code null} if no identifier is defined
081   */
082  @Nullable
083  String getId();
084
085  /**
086   * Get information about the source of the constraint.
087   *
088   * @return the source information
089   */
090  @NonNull
091  ISource getSource();
092
093  /**
094   * The significance of a violation of this constraint.
095   *
096   * @return the level
097   */
098  @NonNull
099  Level getLevel();
100
101  /**
102   * Retrieve the Metapath expression to use to query the targets of the
103   * constraint.
104   *
105   * @return a Metapath expression
106   */
107  @NonNull
108  String getTarget();
109
110  /**
111   * Based on the provided {@code contextNodeItem}, find all nodes matching the
112   * target expression.
113   *
114   * @param item
115   *          the node item to evaluate the target expression against
116   * @param dynamicContext
117   *          the Metapath evaluation context to use
118   * @return the matching nodes as a sequence
119   * @see #getTarget()
120   */
121  @NonNull
122  ISequence<? extends IDefinitionNodeItem<?, ?>> matchTargets(
123      @NonNull IDefinitionNodeItem<?, ?> item,
124      @NonNull DynamicContext dynamicContext);
125
126  /**
127   * Retrieve the remarks associated with the constraint.
128   *
129   * @return the remarks or {@code null} if no remarks are defined
130   */
131  MarkupMultiline getRemarks();
132
133  /**
134   * Used for double dispatch supporting the visitor pattern provided by
135   * implementations of {@link IConstraintVisitor}.
136   *
137   * @param <T>
138   *          the Java type of a state object passed to the visitor
139   * @param <R>
140   *          the Java type of the result returned by the visitor methods
141   * @param visitor
142   *          the visitor implementation
143   * @param state
144   *          the state object passed to the visitor
145   * @return the visitation result
146   * @see IConstraintVisitor
147   */
148  <T, R> R accept(@NonNull IConstraintVisitor<T, R> visitor, T state);
149}
